title: A1502 2014
message: It is possible to replace only the keyboard in A1502 2014? Or need to replace something more?

title: A1502 2014
message:
go to ebay
type the model number folled by what you want
A1502 keyboard
[url]http://www.ebay.com.au/itm/Apple-MacBook-Pro-13-A1502-US-Keyboard-Retina-ME864-ME865-ME866-2013-/162243482079?hash=item25c67711df:g:dacAAOSw8w1YBXD7[/url]
if you see hundreds of results its possible if you see none then its probably impossible or rather difficult
a good example is macbook air lcd, finding the entire display assembly is easy, finding the lcd only is a bit harder

title: A1502 2014
message: Rip the old one out, whack out the remaining rivets with a screw driver/hammer and mount the new keyboard with screws salvaged from an A1278/1286 keyboard. You also need to lift the middle battery cell and remove the trackpad cover.

title: A1502 2014
message: oh yeah i forgot to mention you have to use force to pull the old one out, an unreasonable amount of force

title: A1502 2014
message: my receptionist uses an xcelite 175m to remove each rivet. it's a pain in the ass, but totally doable. Practice on a top case that is too fucked up to reuse. If you don't get the rivet out on the first go, it's stuck in there forever, and you have 1 less screwhole to use.

title: A1502 2014
message:
What about keyboard A1342? I have to replace now. 
It is possible to replace too?
